Title: XSS attack detection with machine learning and n-gram methods
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Habibi, G., BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Surantha, N., BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) is an attack most often carried out by attackers to attack a website by inserting malicious scripts into a website. This attack will take the user to a webpage that has been specifically designed to retrieve user sessions and cookies. Nearly 68% of websites are vulnerable to XSS attacks. In this study, the authors conducted a study by evaluating several machine learning methods, namely Support Vector Machine (SVM), K-Nearest Neighbour (KNN), and Naïve Bayes (NB). The machine learning algorithm is then equipped with the n-gram method to each script feature to improve the detection performance of XSS attacks. The simulation results show that the SVM and n-gram method achieves the highest accuracy with 98%. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Detection script; Machine learning; Malicious script; N-gram; Vulnerable; XSS attack
Index Keywords: Information management; Learning systems; Nearest neighbor search; Support vector machines; Websites; Cross-site scripting; Detection performance; K nearest neighbours (k-NN); Machine learning methods; N-gram methods; User sessions; Xss attacks; Learning algorithms
Funding Text 1: Bina Nusantara University supports the publication of this research.
